get.description: Returns all sections with their parameters from wireless device configuration

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the wireless interface configuration

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the wireless device configuration ('radio0', 'radio1' ...)

bssid.description: BSSID of the wifi network (required if the 'ssid' is not provided)

ssid.description: SSID of the wifi network (required if no 'bssid' is provided)

device.description: Wireless device name to use for joining the wifi network.

post.summary: Scans the environment for nearby Wi-Fi networks
post.description: Scans and returns available wireless networks.

device.description: Wireless device name to use for scanning

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the wireless device configuration ('radio0', 'radio1' ...)

parameters.description: The ID of the wireless device configuration ('radio0', 'radio1' ...)

parameters.description: The ID of the wireless device configuration ('radio0', 'radio1' ...)

data.description: Section names of wireless interfaces to delete.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the wireless interface configuration

items.description:
Signal entry. Values:
a[0] - timestamp when the signal was recored.
a[1] - rate
a[2] - rssi
a[3] - noise

id.description: The ID of the wireless interface configuration

enabled.description: Toggle WiFi device on or off.

hwmode.description: Mode. Selects the wireless protocol to use. Available values depending on the wireless device: '' - Legacy, 'n' - N, 'ac' - AC

channel.description: Specifies the wireless channel to use. “auto” defaults to the lowest available channel

htmode.description: Width. The Wi-Fi channel width is the range of frequencies i.e. how broad the signal is for transferring data.

txpower.description: Transmit Power. The transmit power of an access point radio is proportional to its effective range – the higher the transmit power, the farther the signal can travel and/or the more physical materials it can effectively penetrate and still have data successfully resolved data at the receiver. Available values can be checked in the wireless devices status_full endpoint (options.txpwrlist.dbm values).

country.description: Country Code. Use ISO/IEC 3166 alpha2 country codes.

legacy_rates.description: Allow legacy 802.11b rates. Choose either to allow or not connections that uses legacy 802.11b standard

distance.description: Distance Optimization. Distance to farthest network member in meters.

frag.description: Fragmentation Threshold. The smallest packet size that can be fragmented and transmitted by multiple frames. In areas where interference is a problem, setting a lower fragment threshold might help reduce the probability of unsuccessful packet transfers and increase speed

rts.description: RTS/CTS Threshold. RTS/CTS (Request to Send/Clear to Send) are mechanisms used to reduce frame collisions introduced by the hidden node problem. It can help resolve problems that arise when several access points are in the same area and contend with each other

noscan.description: Force 40MHz mode. Always use 40MHz channels even if the secondary channel overlaps. Using this option does not comply with IEEE 802.11n

beacon_int.description: Beacon Interval. Beacon signal interval in seconds

acs_exclude_dfs.description: ACS exclude DFS. Exclude DFS channels from automatic channel selection

id.description: The ID of the wireless interface configuration

enabled.description: Toggle WiFi interface on or off.

mode.description: Mode. Defines what role this interface will do, Access point to supply WiFi for other devices, or as a Client to use other devices WiFi for WWAN.

device.description: SSID will use these radios. Use one of them if you want seperate SSIDs for each radio or use all of them if you want combined SSID.

ssid.description: Service Set Identifier is a name used to identify access point which is shown when client tries to connect to it.

network.description: The network you want to attach to this wireless interface.

vlan_id.description: Use tagged VLAN from the network as untagged VLAN on the SSID.

wps_pushbutton.description: Enable WPS push-button configuration method. It can only be enabled for a single wireless interface.

mesh_rssi_threshold.description: RSSI threshold for joining. 0 (default) = not using RSSI threshold, 1 = do not change driver default

hidden.description: Hide SSID. Hide Service Set Identifier

bss_transition.description: Enables suggestions for clients to leave this AP if a signal is getting low. For clients not understanding this standard AP can kick them forcibly so they can connect to other AP

ieee80211k.description: Enables suggestions for clients to join other APs when this AP has too many clients

disassoc_low_ack.description: Disassociate On Low Acknowledgement. Allow AP mode to disconnect STAs based on low ACK condition

bgscan_enabled.description: Requests background scans for the purpose of roaming within an ESS

encryption.description: Encryption. The type of WiFi encryption used.

cipher.description: Cipher. An algorithm for performing encryption or decryption.

key.description: Password. Custom passphrase used for authentication (at least 8 characters long).

auth_server.description: Radius-Authentication-Server. Ip address of the authentification server.

auth_port.description: Radius-Authentication-Port. Default port for the server is 1812.

acct_server.description: Radius-Accounting-Server. Ip address of the accounting server.

acct_port.description: Radius-Accounting-Port. Default port for the server is 1813

ieee80211r.description: 802.11r Fast Transition. Enables fast roaming among access points that belong to the same Mobility Domain

macfilter.description: MAC-Address Filter. 'allow' - only allows devices with MAC addresses specified in the MAC list to connect to your WiFi network. 'deny' - blocks devices with MAC addresses specified in the MAC list from connecting to your WiFi network

maclist.description: MAC-List. List of MAC addresses to be included or excluded from connecting to your WiFi network.

delete_from_whitelist.description: Enables MAC removal from whitelist when device reaches IP block counter.

short_preamble.description: Uses Short Preamble, it uses shorter data strings that adds less data to transmit the error redundancy check which means that it is much faster.

dtim_period.description: DTIM Interval. Delivery Traffic Indication Message Interval

wpa_group_rekey.description: Time interval for rekeying GTK. Period of time in between automatic changes of the group key, which all devices on the network share.

skip_inactivity_poll.description: Disable Inactivity Polling. Inactivity polling can be disabled to disconnect stations based on inactivity timeout so that idle stations are more likely to be disconnected even if they are still in range of the AP.

max_inactivity.description: Station inactivity limit. Station inactivity limit in seconds: If a station/client does not send anything in a set time frame, an empty data frame is sent to it in order to verify whether it is still in range. If this frame is not acknowledged, the station will be disassociated and then deauthenticated.

max_listen_interval.description: Maximum allowed Listen Interval. Association will be refused if a client/station attempts to associate with a listen interval greater than this value.

wmm.description: Wi-Fi Multimedia (WMM), previously known as Wireless Multimedia Extensions (WME), is a subset of the 802.11e wireless LAN (WLAN) specification that enhances quality of service (QoS) on a network by prioritizing data packets according to four categories.

short_interval.description: Defines the interval between background scans (in seconds) if the actual signal level of the currently connected access point is worse than signal threshold

long_interval.description: Defines the interval between background scans (in seconds) if the actual signal level of the currently connected access point is better than signal threshold

signal_thresh.description: Defines a threshold (in dBm) that determines if short interval or longer interval will be used

scan_time.description: Time between scans of available access points (minimum 30 sec.)

option.description: Parameter to upload the file to.
